It is a terrestrial, non-vascular plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant exhibits a thallus structure that is often crinkled or lobed, with a dense growth pattern. It plays a role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its habitat. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
